result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L Bartlett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Text Message Reminder of Court Date Agreement
10:38 Defendant Amanda L Bartlett in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dismissed and read-in to 16CF17.

2:00 Defendant Amanda L Bartlett in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll, who appears by phone.  Defendant Isaac R Hanneman in court with attorney Melissa Dalkert. Defendant Pandora L. Weir appears by phone means with attorney Karl Schmidt. Attorney Robert Gardner in court on behalf of Defendant David J Zabawa. Attorney John Bliss in court on behalf of Defendant Matthew J Gordon. Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Weir has filed a motion to sever.
Attorney Lambert agrees with motion except as to Defendant Zabawa.
Attorney Schmidt concurs, but objects that Defendant Weir's case be tried with Defendant Bartlett's cases.
Attorney Carroll states that his client, Defendant Bartlett will be entering a plea before trial.
Court grants Defendant Weir's motion to sever as to Defendant Hanneman and Defendant Gordon. Her case will be tried with Defendant Zabawa and Defendant Bartlett, if Defendant Bartlett wishes to have a trial. Defendants Hanneman and Gordon will be tried alone.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:38 Defendant Amanda L Bartlett in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea is withdrawn and matter is set for for scheduling conference. Bond is reviewed. Bond is continued. Any plea must be done at least 2 days before trial date.
Plea hearing on June 7, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda L Bartlett
Current: 322 7th Ave S, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495 United States  (Effective: 01-11-2016)
Prior: 1041 Lincoln St, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494
1:59 Defendant Amanda L Bartlett in court.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Amanda L Bartlett not in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Service is ineffectual and State requests a warrant.   Court orders a warrant with $250 cash bond.
